Work with development team on regression to confirm this doesn't cause any unexpected connectivity issues.

  • PreProd

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration
fields.System.Description:
Create a clone of the document and carry out migration according to runbook (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HFytivT3debckhBb-LuDDhfazR0AsqJa0-NWZNI_iUQ/edit?usp=sharing) along with aligned DBA and developer. Create a copy of the runbook doc and capture any issues arising / lessons learned to carry forward into subsequent migrations

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration Post-Task - Elastic Pool
fields.System.Description:
Ensure the new database is associated with the Elastic Pool on the shared SQL server and imported into the tfstate.

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration - SQL Server Decommissioning
fields.System.Description:
After minimum 1 week following a successful migration, the source database can be removed from Azure. Pre-Plan this activity for the following sprint after a target migration. Check the box on the relevant runbook doc for that particular migration

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration Pre-Req - App Service Networking
fields.System.Description:
Ensure that the connection path from database clients to the new SQL server is feasible. For example, are any app services vnet integrated? Is the connection to the source database being done securely already or does this need to be addressed as part of the migration. Remediate as required and verify that the app is all working at the source with the changes prior to migration.

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration Pre-Req - SQL Firewall Rules
fields.System.Description:
Ensure a virtual network rule is added to permit the application to connect to the new database via a service endpoint. If any ADF pipelines need to use the database, ensure that appropriate rules are added to permit this connection.

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration Pre-Req - Migration Storage
fields.System.Description:
Create a storage container with the name of the project/environment for the backup / restore data to reside. Ensure that the source database has a role assignment that allows it to WRITE to the migration storage account and the target database has a role assignment that allows it to READ

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: PricingService - SPT - SQL Migration Pre-Req - Deployment Pipeline Permissions
fields.System.Description:
Check if any application deployment pipelines have access to the source database to carry out deployments / schema updates. Ensure that the relevant permissions are carried over onto the shared SQL server resource and appropriately scoped.

Project: PricingService

Environment: All

Affected environments:

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: APIM - Blazor Web Assembly API Protection - Discovery
fields.System.Description:
The challenge we face is that the ideal position is for the API to only accept requests from the frontend application tier. However, since discovering that many SPT applications are Blazor Web Assembly for public consumption, a public facing API is required for the client-side executions to function as intended. As the API has routes to high value on-premise services such as MainFrame we need to consider security implications of this carefully.

We need to collaborate closely with the application team to understand fully what security measures can be implemented to protect high value assets.

This piece is to discover, test and implement APIM in front of SPT public APIs to see what common API protections it can offer to improve our security position.

fields.System.Title: CustomsTax - Storage Account Network Hardening - Discovery
fields.System.Description:
Currently a number of storage accounts in the SPT landing zone are publicly accessible with no networking restrictions. To line up with the security recommendations from Microsoft, we should look to implement a minimum set of sources permitted to connect to the storage account with focus on project accounts that may contain valuable datasets. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/security-recommendations Complete discovery of all the required sources needed to connect to the storage account. This should include any ADF pipelines, App Services, Functions etc and any public sources such as on-premise / Azure regional egress. Example already implemented for StockPlanning: https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-stockplanning?path=/terraform/storageaccount.tf&version=GBmain&line=16&lineEnd=28&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

Project: CustomsTax

  • Dev
  • PreProd
  • Prod

fields.System.Title: Cupid - Silo'd Virtual Network Migration - Discovery
fields.System.Description:
Cupid networking exists on silo's vnets that exist in the resource groups with the workloads:



We need to migrate from these networks onto the LandingZone vnets into dedicated subnets as per conversations in Cloud Services chat.

Discovery

(Take notes of findings)
  • What networks exist already and how are they used and by what?
  • What new subnets would need to be created in the LandingZone vnet and what address spaces can be used for these given the size of the current networks? NOTE: Check if the existing sizes allow for sufficient auto-scaling. /29 might be a problem if application loads were to increase.
  • What delegations and service endpoints need to be included on any new subnets?
  • Are there any dedicated NSGs attached to the existing networking that we need to rules over in the LandingZone vnet?
  • What networking restrictions / firewalls may be referring to these networks and CIDRs (ie SQL Servers, storage accounts) that need updating

Output

A list of proposed new subnets and their attributes to enter into https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/inf-core-landingzones?path=/variables/tfvars/RetailStockLogistics/subnets.tfvars

A high-level written sequence of steps planned to carry out a Dev environment networking migration. For example
  • Create API subnet with a cider of 10.1.x.x/29 delegated to Microsoft.Web with service endpoints Microsoft.Storage and Microsoft.SQL
  • Condition the vnet integration on App Service X to the new subnet ID for the dev environment.
  • Include new subnet ID in PaaS firewall of SQL Server

Work with the application template to upgrade the .NET 6 runtime to .NET 8 as part of their Wholesale code releases. The application stack values on the App Service need to be updated in order to benefit from performance and security improvements in the latest .NET version used in the application code. NOTE: This can be ahead or following the release as the runtime is backwards AND forwards compatible.

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - Function Invocation Visibility - Discovery / Dev
fields.System.Description:
Issue raised by Abrar that dev team can't see invocations in Production:



Giving WRITE access to the app is probably not recommended as it is an important guardrail to protect the environment. Instead proposed a monitoring solution, could include an App Insights query based visualisation on the Grafana dashboards.


_________________________________

  • Draft some KQL queries that show top level success / failure invocations for each ZEOS Function App.
  • Implement a visualisation in Grafana based on these queries
  • Demonstrate them in the Dev environment to check that this satisfies the requirement of the Dev and Support teams.

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - Function Invocation Visibility - Production
fields.System.Description: Promote solution developed in Dev to Production (Grafana does not have other non-production envs at the moment)

fields.System.Title: Shared Infrastructure - Consolidate Function App Storage Accounts - DEV
fields.System.Description:
There's a sprawl of storage accounts in SPT Shared Infrastructure - 4 are used by Function Apps:



(dev pictured)

These CAN be consolidated into a NEW single account and should be to simplify the infrastructure.

Maybe named like this if available:
`lower("func${module.naming.convention["storage_account"]}")`

Conditions can be used on storage account parameters of the Function apps to migrate to the new storage account per environment.

NOTE:
  • Functions may restart when storage configuration changes
  • Any in-memory state or temporary files will be lost
As a result the development team must be aligned when making the change in any given environment.

fields.System.Title: PricingService - Key Vault Network ACL - Discovery / Dev
fields.System.Description:
Noticed that the PricingService Key Vault has a redundant network ACL configured (comments added just now):


The default action is allow, making the rule redundant. Also an uncommented static list is used rather than sourcing values from the 'global config' module.

Review this configuration and see if we are able to implement properly using global config / default deny rule, limiting connections to those from a minimal set of trusted sources.

NOTE: Might form part of wider review across the projects, as I'm keen to ensure that all Key Vaults have suitable and sensible ACLs in place and this is supported from brief interactions with @Poole, Mark from a cloud architecture perspective.

NOTE: The blocker to this is likely to be if application teams are using cloud-hosted ADO agents, as I think some pipelines refer to Key Vaults for secrets.

____________________________

Output:

  • Review Key Vault usage for Pricing Service and identify clients to be considered
  • Propose an ACL and run by project stakeholders
  • Implement this ACL in the Dev environment and engage the application team to check all Key Vault consumers pass tests.

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - 3PL API Health Monitor
fields.System.Description:
The ZEOS project has a requirement to quickly detect and respond to failures that may occur in the interaction between the ZEOS EventPrc function and the 3PL integration layer.

The application team are creating error level log entries containing the message 'ArticleProcessingError'
  • Create a KQL query to detect log entries
  • Use this query to form a log alert to generate alerts in the SPT - Azure Alerts Google chat space
NOTE: We may also need to direct these events to ServiceNow via the second framework function in the future.

fields.System.Title: Getting Started with OpenTelemetry (LFS148)

fields.System.Title: Monitoring - "Resolved" Alert Tuning / Alert Processing Rule
fields.System.Description:
There's a number of cases where an alert is triggered, followed later by a resolved notification.

On the surface this seems ok, but depending on the metric that were looking at the resolved status is false...

For example:



A data pipeline failed, but the resolution was just the failure rate dropping back below the threshold in the next measurement window.

We need to identify cases like this, and include some alert processing to avoid sending the resolution messages to the target alert group.

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/monitor_alert_processing_rule_action_group

fields.System.Title: Cupid - Enforce Authorisation Code Flow - Prod
fields.System.Description:
Noticed recently that the main App Registration for the Cupid web app has an expired secret (for 9 months):



However the application is unaffected and was not picked up by the automated process to flag this identity for secret rotation. (I think because the department is missing from the naming convention pre-dating the standard)

Investigate what this service principal is used for, why the expiry hasn't impacted the application and any next steps required either to rotate or remove the secret.

___________________________________

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-oauth2-implicit-grant-flow

I think what's happening it it's using implicit flow, we need to enforce the more secure 'Authorisation Code Flow'
NOTE: CHG Required
  • Omit the implicit grant block for Prod:
https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-cupidwebservice?path=/terraform/cupid_web_app_reg.tf&version=GBmain&line=30&lineEnd=32&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=6&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents
  • Test authentication

I included all Azure egress IPs on the ADLS storage account ACL, but to achieve the levels of segmentation we're aiming for this needs to be replaced with just the UKsouth ones and all other traffic should be permitted with vnet rules and service endpoints.

I omitted Production during a previous PR as I think I'll need a CHG just in case anything is using these routes at the moment in the Prod environment.

fields.System.Title: Gift Card - External ADLS Account - Dev
fields.System.Description:
The final Data Landing Zone Sub Pub design will include an externally facing ADLS account in addition to the existing internal one.

Whilst this is not yet reflected on the design pattern, it's required to support the Giftcard project.

NOTE: this resource and it's configuration will be another component to import to whatever final solution is designed for the pattern as technical debt in the future.

In Development environment ONLY:
  • https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-datalanding?path=/terraform/adls.tf - re-factor to 'internal'
  • Include new mapping for external subscribers with SFTP local users with specific access to containers.

SFTP must be enabled for the external account:
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/storage_account.html#sftp_enabled-1

We will need to manage local users as code, mapped to third parties:
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/storage_account_local_user
(which should only have access to the container it's mapped to)

fields.System.Title: PricingService - Networking Migration - Discovery
fields.System.Description:
PricingService networking exists on silo's vnets that exist in the resource groups with the workloads:




We need to migrate from these networks onto the LandingZone vnets into dedicated subnets as per conversations in Cloud Services chat.

Discovery

Take notes of findings(
  • What networks exist already and how are they used and by what?
  • What new subnets would need to be created in the LandingZone vnet and what address spaces can be used for these given the size of the current networks? NOTE: Check if the existing sizes allow for sufficient auto-scaling. /29 might be a problem if application loads were to increase.
  • What delegations and service endpoints need to be included on any new subnets?
  • What networking restrictions / firewalls may be referring to these networks and CIDRs (ie SQL Servers, storage accounts) that need updating

Output

A list of proposed new subnets and their attributes to enter into https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/inf-core-landingzones?path=/variables/tfvars/RetailStockLogistics/subnets.tfvars

A high-level written sequence of steps planned to carry out a Dev environment networking migration as refined sub-tasks. For example
  • Create API subnet with a cider of 10.1.x.x/29 delegated to Microsoft.Web with service endpoints Microsoft.Storage and Microsoft.SQL
  • Condition the vnet integration on App Service X to the new subnet ID for the dev environment.
  • Include new subnet ID in PaaS firewall of SQL Server

fields.System.Title: Cupid - Easy Auth Implementation - Dev
fields.System.Description:
We learned that the existing implementation of authentication for the Cupid web app is using implicit grant flow, which is strongly advised against by Microsoft:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-oauth2-implicit-grant-flow

The long-term solution is to implement EasyAuth for Cupid which would allow the platform to carry out authentication in a using much more secure method:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/overview-authentication-authorization

_____________________________________

Example in Finance:

https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/FinanceTech.CoreFinanceDevOps/_git/Next.Finance.Devops.Infrastructure.GLRules?path=/terraform/regional/web_app_frontend.tf&version=GBmain&line=215&lineEnd=235&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents
